conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine acceleration direction.
The x-axis represents time in seconds; the y-axis represents velocity in m/s.
Focus on the time interval from 0 to 10 seconds.
At 0 seconds, velocity is 0 m/s; at 10 seconds, velocity is approximately 20 m/s.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
Velocity increases from 0 m/s to 20 m/s, indicating positive acceleration.
The slope of the tangent line on the velocity-time graph gives instantaneous acceleration.
Tangent lines between 0 and 10 seconds show consistently positive slope.
Positive slope indicates acceleration is in the same direction as velocity, directed downwards.
The direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is downwards.
